result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Laura R. Townsend
Current: 912 1st Avenue, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2022)
Prior: 226 Gruber Street, Antigo, WI 54409 

(Judge advised Def. to file written address change in criminal case; Def. provided correct case number but wrong case type. There is no 22FA140.)

3:56 PM/Room 301.  Defendant Laura R. Townsend in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. wants to waive right to an attorney. Court reviews waiver of attorney form. Court reviews charges and possible penalties. The Court finds Def. has knowingly and voluntarily waived right to counsel, finds Def. competent and will allow Def. to represent self. Court gives Def. options. Def. waives time limit for P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Def. to provide updated address to COC in writing.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
2:45 PM Defendant Laura R. Townsend appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Court reviews history of case.  Def. heard on counsel and completed court appointed atty form.  CC informs needs to turn in. State has complied with victim rights.  Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Cooperate with the Langlade County Department of Social Services.

1:19 PM in Room 203. Defendant Laura R. Townsend appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State heard on bond, recommends $3,500 cash bond with conditions maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, cooperate with the Langlade County Department of Social Services. Def. heard on bond. Remarks by the Court. The Court orders $2,500 cash bond with conditions as requested.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
